Sometimes, however, the bullet finds its way into the gun and Barney shoots it. Andy then holds out his hand, and Barney reluctantly gives the gun up for a while.

question: How does George Costanza's fiancee die on Seinfeld?
answerDescription: Susan Ross, George's on-again, off-again girlfriend and later fiancée, dies from licking cheap, toxic wedding invitation envelopes George bought during their engagement.

question: Which character becomes a wanted fugitive during the final season of The Office?
answerDescription: After becoming a wanted fugitive, Creed fakes his own death, only to be discovered living at the office in Ryan's old closet. Creed sings a song on the guitar for the office before being arrested.

question: Which actor on Full House wore fake teeth?
answerDescription: Because Mary-Kate and Ashley (who both played Michelle, the youngest member of the Tanner family) were losing different teeth at different times, they had to wear fake teeth towards the end of the series to keep up the facade that Michelle Tanner was one person.

question: Who was the captain of The Love Boat?
answerDescription: The Love Boat was helmed by Captain Merrill Stubing played by Gavin MacLeod. For nine seasons, audiences tuned in to see what antics he and his crew would get into on a weekly basis.

question: Which actress lied about her age when she auditioned for That '70s Show?
answerDescription: Producers for That '70s Show wanted their cast to be 18 or older to work around hour restrictions for minors. That was a problem for 14-year-old Mila Kunis, who knew she was right for the role of bratty Jackie Burkhart. When asked how old she was, Kunis told producers that she'd be 18 on her birthday--but didn't specify which birthday she was referring to.

question: Which sitcom did Steve Urkel from Family Matters make a guest appearance on?
answerDescription: In a 1991 episode of Full House ("Stephanie Gets Framed"), Steve is called in to help Stephanie Tanner (Jodie Sweetin) deal with her anxieties after she has to get glasses.

question: Who was the first actor to be nominated for an Emmy for the same character on three different sitcoms?
answerDescription: For his performance as Frasier Crane in Cheers, Kelsey Grammer was Emmy Award-nominated twice as an Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Comedy Series but did not win in 1988 and 1990. For the same role in the Wings episode "Planes, Trains, and Visiting Cranes", he was Emmy-nominated for the same category in 1992. For the same role in Cheers spin-off Frasier, Grammer was consecutively nominated as an Outstanding Lead Actor in a Comedy Series during the show's whole run except in 2003. He won that Lead category in 1994, 1995, 1998, and 2004.

question: Which sitcom opens with a shot of the main character heading down to "the Fishin' Hole"?
answerDescription: The Andy Griffith Show follows the antics of the sheriff of the idyllic town of Mayberry, N.C. It opens with that famous shot of stars Andy and Opie heading down to "the Fishin' Hole," set to some of the catchiest whistling ever.

question: What was the most-watched episode of Friends?
options: "THE ONE WHERE ROSS AND RACHEL ... YOU KNOW"
"THE ONE WHERE RACHEL HAS A BABY"
answerDescription: The two-part episode that aired after the Super Bowl in 1996 was the most-watched episode of the series. 52.9 million people tuned in as Chandler almost hooked up with Julia Roberts, Joey was stalked by Brooke Shields, and Monica and Rachel fought over Jean Claude Van Damme.

question: Which character on The Office was originally an assistant casting director on the show?
answerDescription: Phyllis Smith was initially a casting associate for the show, but producers loved her so much while she was reading lines with other actors during auditions that she was offered the role of soft-spoken saleswoman Phyllis Vance, a character created specifically for her.

question: How many different actors played Topanga's parents on Boy Meets World?
answerDescription: Over the course of the series, Topanga's parents were played by five different actors. Talk about family issues.

question: Which popular '80s sitcom killed off mom?
answerDescription: Diff'rent Strokes follows the life of two boys who are adopted by a wealthy businessman after their mother dies. In Full House, a sportswriter with three daughters loses his wife in a car accident and moves into a house with his best friend and his wife's brother because he needs their help raising the kids. In Who's the Boss?, a former professional baseball player moves to Fairfield, Connecticut, after his wife dies to raise his daughter away from the city.

question: Which actor tried to get the Olsen twins fired from Full House?
answerDescription: John Stamos almost had the Olsen twins fired while filming the pilot. He hated how much they cried while filming, but the producers disliked the red-headed twins who replaced them, so they brought back Mary-Kate and Ashley.

question: Where is Cheers set?
answerDescription: Cheers is set in a bar in Boston, Massachusetts, where a group of locals meet to drink, relax, and socialize.

question: The title character from Sabrina the Teenage Witch first appeared in which comic book?
answerDescription: Sabrina was created by writer George Gladir and artist Dan DeCarlo, and first appeared in Archie's Madhouse #22 (Oct. 1962). Storylines of the character at elementary-school-age also appear under the title "Sabrina--That Cute Little Witch" in almost all of the Little Archie comics.

question: What is the real name of Marcel the monkey from Friends?
answerDescription: Marcel the monkey is actually a female and her name is Katie.

question: What is the nickname for the tent that serves as the quarters for the senior surgical staff on M*A*S*H?
answerDescription: At the beginning of the series, the Swamp held four doctors: Hawkeye, Trapper, "Spearchucker" Jones and Frank Burns. After the departure of Jones, the number of residents dropped to three and remained so until the end of the series. B.J. moved in after the departure of Trapper and Winchester after the departure of Burns.

question: Which Brady Bunch character utters the now famous catch phrase, "Marcia, Marcia, Marcia!"
answerDescription: When Jan's teacher, Mrs. Watson, gushes over former pupil Marcia, it's the last straw for Jan who is sick and tired of being compared to her older, seemingly perfect sister. She dumps all of Marcia's awards and trophies in the closet and complains that all she hears is "Marcia this, Marcia that ... Marcia, Marcia, Marcia."

question: Why does Mary go to jail in The Mary Tyler Moore Show?
answerDescription: When Mary gets a scoop in the form of secret documents from a Deep Throat-like source, Ted takes all the credit for the story ... until Special Agent Harris from the Justice Department starts asking questions. Mary chooses jail rather than revealing her source, resulting in a comical scene in which she shares a cell with prostitutes. "What did they get you for?" asks one. "Impersonating a Barbie doll, right?"

question: Which character on The Big Bang Theory suffers from selective mutism?
answerDescription: Raj is unable to speak in front of women outside his own family due to selective mutism--unless he's drunk, in which case he says very inappropriate things.

question: What is Archie Bunker's occupation?
answerDescription: His uncle got him a job on a loading dock after World War II, and by the 1970s he is a foreman.

question: What is the name of the resident con artist on Cheers?
answerDescription: Sam has standing orders to have Harry the Hat (known for his signature fedora) thrown out of the bar on sight, but Harry sometimes helps the gang out--partly from sentiment, and partly to protect the Cheers gang from operators even more unscrupulous than himself. As Harry notes, "I don't like the idea of someone else plucking my pigeons."

question: Where did Greg Brady live during the last season of The Brady Bunch?
answerDescription: It wasn't until the end of the fourth season that Greg got his own room--in the attic.

question: Which Everybody Loves Raymond character had a bed-wetting problem as a child?
answerDescription: Growing up, Robert thought he had a bed-wetting problem, but it was actually Ray pouring water in his bed while he slept.

question: Whose wedding holds the record for the highest rated soap opera episode in American daytime television history?
answerDescription: In 1981, more Americans watched Luke and Laura's wedding on General Hospital than Prince Charles and Lady Diana's actual televised nuptials. The episode brought in 30 million viewers and remains the highest-rated hour in American soap opera history.

question: Which Days of Our Lives character was once possessed by the devil?
answerDescription: In 1995, Marlena was featured in a supernatural possession storyline. Soap Opera Digest editor Stephanie Sloane said the story "completely changed the face of daytime storytelling in the 1990s," but Entertainment Weekly called it "The Dumbest Soap Plot Ever."

question: Which actress allowed The Young and the Restless producers to use footage of her real-life plastic surgery?
answerDescription: Far from trying to conceal her 1984 facelift, Cooper had it written into the storyline, so that her grand dame character Katherine Chancellor got one at the same time.

question: Which famous actor got his start playing young Mason Capwell on NBC's Santa Barbara?
answerDescription: DiCaprio only appeared in one episode of Santa Barbara, but it earned him a nomination for Best Young Actor in a Daytime Series.

question: How many husbands did Erica Kane have on All My Children?
answerDescription: Susan Lucci played Erica Kane for more than 40 years. During that time, her penchant for tying the proverbial knot became the stuff of soap opera legend as she married 10 different men in 11 wedding ceremonies, although four of her marriages were later invalidated.

question: What dying gift did General Hospital's B.J. Jones leave her cousin Maxie?
answerDescription: Seven-year-old B. J. was left brain-dead after her school van was hit by a drunk driver. Her father, Tony, made the decision to donate B. J.'s organs, and her heart was transplanted into her ailing cousin. In a moving scene, Tony laid his head on his niece's chest and quietly listened to his daughter's heart, once again pulsing with life.

question: What did Bo nickname Hope on Days of Our Lives?
answerDescription: Bo Brady and Hope Williams changed the face of daytime when rebel Bo came riding into town on his motorcycle in 1983 and fell for the rich and feisty Hope Williams, whom he later nicknamed Fancy Face.

question: Who played Erica Kane's daughter on All My Children?
answerDescription: From 1993 to 1995, Sarah Michelle Gellar played Kendall Hart, "the scheming daughter of the biggest schemer of them all." The role was later taken over by Alicia Minshew.

question: Who shot J.R. Ewing?
answerDescription: In the final scene of the 1979-80 season of Dallas, J.R. hears a noise outside his office, walks out to the corridor to look, and is shot twice by an unseen assailant. The episode, titled "A House Divided", was broadcast on March 21, 1980, and viewers would have to wait until the November episode "Who Done It" to learn that the shooter was Kristin Shepard, J.R.'s mistress and his wife's sister.

question: Who played Ben Harper on the CBS soap opera Love of Life?
answerDescription: Before he was Superman, 22-year-old Christopher Reeve played Ben Harper on Love of Life. A villain audiences loved to hate, Reeve's Harper was a devious conniver who was married to two women at the same time.

question: Which The Bold and the Beautiful character fell over a banister at the Forrester house and went into a coma?
answerDescription: After former prostitute Jackie Marone had an affair with Eric, she got into an argument with Stephanie who "accidently" threw her off a balcony.

question: What was the first prime time soap opera?
answerDescription: Faraway Hill aired live on the DuMont Television Network on Wednesday nights at 9:00 PM. It ran from October 2, 1946, to December 18, 1946. The show had a budget of around $300 an episode.

question: The General Hospital Nurses Ball is an annual event to raise money for the cure of which disease?
answerDescription: The Nurses Ball is one of Port Charles' most glamorous charity events dedicated to HIV/AIDS awareness and research.

question: Who kidnapped Hope on Days of Our Lives?
answerDescription: Hope has been kidnapped a lot.

question: In Gene Roddenberry's original treatment for Star Trek, what was the name of the Starship?
answerDescription: Gene Roddenberry's original concept for Star Trek was that of a "Wagon Train to the Stars", and included the Starship Yorktown plus significantly different characters from the ones we know today.

question: Who was the first actor to play a member of all three of the major alien races in Star Trek?
answerDescription: Mark Lenard, best known for his role as Sarek, Spock's father, was the first actor to play a member of all three of the major alien races: Vulcan, Romulan (in the episode "Balance of Terror"), and Klingon (the commander of the Klingon attack group at the beginning of Star Trek: The Motion Picture (1979)).

question: What is Sulu's primary position on the U.S.S. Enterprise?
answerDescription: Hikaru Sulu, served as helmsman of the U.S.S. Enterprise.

question: Which Star Trek captain has an artificial heart?
answerDescription: In 2327, Jean-Luc Picard received an artificial heart after he was stabbed by a Nausicaan during a bar brawl.

question: Who was the first Vulcan science officer aboard the starship Enterprise?
answerDescription: As a Sub-Commander serving the Vulcan High Command, T'Pol was stationed aboard the original Enterprise in April 2151, as an observer to Captain Jonathan Archer and his crew, who the High Command insisted were not ready for interstellar space exploration. After the success of the Enterprise's initial mission led to the vessel being given an extended exploration mandate, T'Pol requested to stay aboard as science officer.

question: Which alien race did Ronald Reagan say reminded him of Congress?
answerDescription: When Ronald Reagan visited the set of Star Trek: The Next Generation during filming of "Redemption" (1991), he remarked: "I like them [the Klingons]. They remind me of Congress."

question: Which species was the first to discover warp drive?
answerDescription: Vulcans developed warp drive capabilities around the 9th century B.C. (Earth time), long before Klingons (9th century A.D.), Borg (15th century A.D.), and Humans (21st century A.D.).

question: What Star Trek character was labeled "unknown sample" when discovered by Bajoran scientists?
answerDescription: One of "the hundred" sent out by the Founders long ago to explore the galaxy, Odo was found adrift in 2356 in the Denorios Belt by Bajorans. Since Odo had not yet learned how to morph into a humanoid appearance, he appeared in his natural gelatinous form. Bajoran scientists, not sure of what Odo actually was, put him in a container and labeled it "unknown sample".

question: Which Star Trek actor originally devised the Klingon language?
answerDescription: The language's basic sound, along with a few words, was first devised by actor James Doohan ("Scotty") and producer Jon Povill for Star Trek: The Motion Picture, which marked the first time the language had been heard on screen. In all previous appearances, Klingons spoke in English.

question: What character was adopted by the Vulcan ambassador Sarek?
answerDescription: Michael Burnham was the first human to attend the Vulcan Learning Center and Vulcan Science Academy as a xenoanthropologist.

question: Who serves as communications officer in the final episode of Star Trek: The Original Series?
answerDescription: Lt. Uhura does not appear in "Turnabout Intruder", the last episode of Star Trek: TOS. She is replaced by Lt. Lisa, who some fans have identified as "the night shift communications officer".

question: What actress turned down the role of Seven of Nine four times?
answerDescription: Jeri Ryan turned down the role of Seven of Nine four times; she only accepted the part after repeated lobbying by executive producer Jeri Taylor.

question: What actor from Star Trek: The Original Series lost his right middle finger during World War II?
answerDescription: James Doohan ("Scotty") lost his right middle finger during WWII. Most of his scenes are shot to hide it. In scenes with a close-up view of Scotty's hands (operating the transporter for example) someone else's hands were always used. However, it is noticeable on a few rare occasions. The most obvious example is "The Trouble With Tribbles" when Scotty comes into the Rec Room with his arms filled with Tribbles. Take a close look at his hands. You can clearly see he's missing a finger.

question: What future Starfleet captain survived the Battle of Wolf 359?
answerDescription: During the Battle of Wolf 359, the U.S.S. Saratoga was destroyed, but the ship's first officer, Benjamin Sisko, escaped with his son. An estimated 11,000 people were killed during the battle, including Sisko's wife, Jennifer.

question: What is Lieutenant Uhura's first name?
answerDescription: While guest-starring on the game show Super Password on January 7, 1987, Nichelle Nichols revealed that Uhura's first name was "Nyota". "Nyota" is the Swahili word for "star".

question: What is Deanna Troi's favorite food?
answerDescription: Troi is an avid connoisseur of chocolate. She  once remarked that she had never met a chocolate she didn't like, and in one episode, she instructs Commander Riker in the fine art of eating chocolate.

question: What ship is Sulu assigned when he's promoted to captain?
answerDescription: Sulu is promoted to captain and given command of the U.S.S. Excelsior three years before the events of Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country.

question: What character dies in the series finale of Star Trek: Enterprise?
answerDescription: In the series finale, chief engineer Charles "Trip" Tucker III sacrifices himself to save the rest of the crew.

question: Which Star Trek captain suffers from androgenic alopecia?
answerDescription: Captain Picard suffers from a severe case of androgenic alopecia ... also known as male pattern baldness.

question: Which of the following was not a founding species of the United Federation of Planets?
answerDescription: Captain Jonathan Archer helped forge an alliance between the formerly belligerent Vulcan, Andorian, and Tellarite states that culminated in a formal union in 2161. The Bajorans are a non-Federation species.

question: What weapon did Kirk and Spock use when they fought for possession of T'Pring during Spock's Pon farr ritual in "Amok Time"?
answerDescription: A lirpa is a Vulcan weapon consisting of a wooden staff a little over a meter in length, with a semicircular blade at one end and a metal bludgeon on the other.

question: Who was originally cast as Captain Janeway?
answerDescription: Geneviève Bujold was originally cast as Captain Janeway but dropped out on the second day of filming.

question: Which of the following is a species of intelligent turtles?
answerDescription: The Rigellians were a species of intelligent turtles. According to information obtained by Doctor Phlox, they are believed to have four or five genders.

question: If Edith Keeler doesn't die in "The City on the Edge of Forever", what will happen?
options: A VIRUS WILL WIPE OUT HUMANITY
THE NAZIS WILL RULE THE WORLD
answerDescription: Keeler was supposed to die in an accident that was prevented by McCoy when he stumbled through the time portal. Instead, Keeler started a pacifist movement, causing the United States to delay its entrance into World War II, allowing Nazi Germany enough time to develop a nuclear weapon and win the war. In order to undo the damage to the timeline, she has to die.

question: Which character serves as the head of security for the space station Deep Space Nine?
answerDescription: Odo is a member of a shapeshifting race called Changelings. He uses his unique abilities to maintain security on the DS9 station and, later, aids the Bajoran people and the Federation throughout the Dominion War against his own people, the Founders.

question: Who created the Bajoran wormhole?
answerDescription: Benjamin Sisko and Jadzia Dax are the first to make contact with the wormhole and its creators, noncorporeal beings known as the Prophets. It is they who provided Orb-like energy artifacts to the Bajorans that became the basis of Bajoran religion.

question: What type of weapons technology does a phaser use?
answerDescription: Phasers are common particle-beam weapons first seen in the original Star Trek series.

question: In Star Trek: Nemesis, what did Shinzon use to assassinate the entire Romulan senate?
answerDescription: Thalaron radiation, even in small amounts, petrifies living tissue almost instantly. Its properties allow its range and area of effect to be precisely controlled, from encompassing a single room to engulfing an entire planet.

question: What species, known to the Borg as "species 329", were deemed unworthy of assimilation?
answerDescription: The Kazon an aggressive warrior species from the Delta Quadrant, were divided into eighteen different sects. Each sect had possession of different natural resources over which the sects fought each other.

question: In "Mirror, Mirror", what has replaced the United Federation of Planets?
answerDescription: In "Mirror, Mirror", the Federation has been replaced by a brutal Terran Empire in which officers ascend in rank by assassinating their superiors, uniforms are more revealing, sidearms are standard issue (as well as daggers for officers), and senior officers routinely torture subordinates.

question: What was Majel Barrett's first role on Star Trek?
answerDescription: Majel Barrett, who would later marry Gene Roddenberry, made her Star Trek debut in "The Cage" (1964), Roddenberry's original pilot. She played "Number One", Captain Pike's unnamed first officer. She would later play Nurse Chapel (ST:TOS), Lwaxana Troi (ST:TNG) and M'Ress (ST:TAS), as well as the voice of the ships computer in multiple incarnations of the series.

question: What type of fish does Captain Picard keep in his ready room?
answerDescription: Livingston was a lionfish kept by Captain Jean-Luc Picard in his ready room aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise-D for the duration of the ship's existence. The fish has its own trading card in the ST:TNG card series.

question: What ST:TNG prop was designed using an automotive air filter and a hair band?
answerDescription: Geordi's VISOR was originally improvised from an automotive air filter and a hair band.

question: In "Mirror, Mirror", what weapon does Kirk keep concealed in his quarters?
answerDescription: The Tantalus field was a 23rd century device found aboard the I.S.S. Enterprise in the mirror universe, which could be used to monitor and eliminate enemies from existence with the touch of a button.

question: Which of the following characters was trapped in a transporter buffer for 75 years?
answerDescription: In "Relics", the crew of the U.S.S. Enterprise-D discovers Montgomery Scott alive in a transporter buffer while investigating the 75-year-old wreck of a Federation transport vessel.

question: What original Star Trek actor appeared in the pilot episode of Star Trek: The Next Generation?
answerDescription: DeForest Kelley appeared as 137-year-old Leonard McCoy in "Encounter at Farpoint", the pilot episode of Star Trek: The Next Generation, reprising his role from the original series. As he inspects the Enterprise-D, he tells Data, "You treat her like a lady ... and she'll always bring you home."

question: What character asks Data if he is "fully functional"?
answerDescription: In "The Naked Now", Tasha Yar asks Data if he is "fully functional". He replies that he is not only functional "in every way", but also "programmed in multiple techniques." "Oh you jewel," Tasha says, "that's exactly what I hoped!"

question: Who was the first Kelpien to enter Starfleet?
answerDescription: A Starfleet Science Officer and Lieutenant Commander on the U.S.S. Shenzhou, Saru is Kelpien, an alien prey species that have biologically evolved the ability to sense threats.

question: What were the last words of the last episode of Star Trek: The Original Series?
answerDescription: The final episode of the Original Series deals with gender inequality. A bitter woman steals Captain Kirk's body in order to take command of the Enterprise, an opportunity that she feels has been unfairly denied her. Kirk's last words are: "Her life could have been as rich as any woman's, if only ... If only ..."

question: Who was originally offered the role of Spock?
answerDescription: Martin Landau was originally offered the role of Spock, but declined. Later, Leonard Nimoy, who did accept the part, took over the role of the disguise-expert on "Mission: Impossible" when Landau left that show. Landau later headed his own sci-fi series, "Space: 1999" (1975).

question: What type of pet does Captain Archer have on Enterprise?
answerDescription: A 22nd-century beagle, Porthos, is Captain Archer's closest companion and confidant.

question: What two stars of Star Trek: Deep Space Nine were married in real life in 1997?
answerDescription: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine stars Alexander Siddig (Dr. Julian Bashir) and Nana Visitor (Maj. Kira Nerys) were married in real life in 1997 (after the show's fourth season).

question: Who was the first real astronaut to appear in any Star Trek episode?
answerDescription: Mae C. Jemison was the first real astronaut to appear in any Star Trek show. She played "Lt. Palmer" in a Star Trek: The Next Generation episode entitled "Second Chances" (May 22, 1993).

question: In which Star Trek series did writer Larry Niven introduce the cat-like alien race, the Kzinti, into the Star Trek universe?
answerDescription: In "Slaver Weapon", an episode of Star Trek: The Animated Series, writer Larry Niven introduced the cat-like alien race, the Kzinti, from his "Known Space" novels into the Star Trek universe.

question: Who was the first Star Trek actor to write a Star Trek story?
answerDescription: Walter Koenig, who wrote an episode of Star Trek: The Animated Series entitled "The Infinite Vulcan," became the first Star Trek actor to ever write a Star Trek story. Over the following decades, many Trek actors would write films, novels and comic books based upon "Star Trek", and many more would direct TV episodes and movies.

question: What was Seven of Nine's name before she was assimilated by the Borg?
answerDescription: Seven of Nine was born Annika Hansen, the daughter of eccentric exobiologists Magnus and Erin Hansen. She was assimilated by the Borg at age six, along with her parents.

question: Who is the youngest captain in Starfleet history?
answerDescription: James Kirk was born in Riverside, Iowa on 22 March 2233, and at age 34 became the youngest captain in Starfleet history.

question: What is the Klingon homeworld?
answerDescription: Qo'noS (transliterated to Kronos in English) is the Klingon homeworld and the capital of the Klingon Empire.

question: According to Klingon mythology, what is the place where all life began?
answerDescription: QI'tu' (also spelled Qui'Tu) was a Klingon term for paradise, and the source of all creation.

question: What was the first ship James T. Kirk served on?
answerDescription: Upon graduation, James Kirk was promoted to lieutenant and posted to the U.S.S. Farragut under Captain Garrovick.

question: What is Mr. Chekhov's first name?
answerDescription: Pavel Andreievich Chekov took his first posting as navigator on the U.S.S. Enterprise under Captain James T. Kirk.

question: What is Captain Kirk's middle name?
answerDescription: Captain Kirk was named after his paternal grandfather -- Tiberius Kirk.

question: Which of the following starships survived the Battle of Wolf 359?
answerDescription: Although it suffered heavy damage, the U.S.S. Ahwahnee survived the Battle of Wolf 359 and was salvaged after the battle and restored. Of the 40 starships Admiral J. P. Hanson gathered to battle the Borg, it was the only one to survive.

question: Which Star Trek captain loves baseball?
answerDescription: Sisko loves baseball, a sport that has largely disappeared by the 24th century. On his desk, he keeps a baseball given to him by an alien impersonating Buck Bokai, his favorite historical baseball player halfway through the first season.

question: Who convinced Nichelle Nichols not to leave Star Trek after the first season?
answerDescription: Nichols planned to leave Star Trek after the first season and return to musical theater, but a chance meeting with Martin Luther King, Jr. convinced her to stay. He was a fan of the show and felt that her character signified a future of greater racial harmony and cooperation.

question: Who was Spock's mother?
answerDescription: Amanda Grayson was a schoolteacher from Earth who married the Vulcan diplomat Sarek and gave birth to Spock in 2230.

question: Which Star Trek series has a female Chief Engineer?
answerDescription: B'Elanna Torres is the half-human half-Klingon Chief Engineer of the U.S.S. Voyager.

question: What creature killed half the crew of the U.S.S. Farragut?
answerDescription: In "Obsession", Captain Kirk becomes obsessed with destroying a deadly entity he once encountered in his youth -- a dikironium cloud creature that killed half the crew of the U.S.S. Farragut when he was a phaser station operator on the ship.

question: Which Chief Medical Officer is a Denobulan?
answerDescription: Phlox is a Denobulan, and was on Earth as part of the Interspecies Medical Exchange when called to serve aboard the Enterprise. As part of the Exchange, he corresponds regularly with his human counterpart on Denobula Triaxa.

question: Which Star Trek captain was forced to impersonate a historical figure to preserve the timeline?
answerDescription: In "Past Tense", Sisko is transported to early 21st Century Earth where he accidentally causes the death of Gabriel Bell, an important historical figure in early 21st century America. Sisko takes Bell's place to preserve the timeline.

question: What Cardassian spy had a love affair with Chakotay?
answerDescription: In "State of Flux", Seska is revealed to be a Cardassian spy who had infiltrated a Maquis cell that was absorbed by Voyager. During her time with the Maquis, Seska had a love affair with Chakotay.

question: Which Star Trek captain was widowed?
answerDescription: Sisko's wife, Jennifer, was among the casualties of the Battle at Wolf 359.

question: What kind of pancakes did B'Elanna Torres' grandmother make for her as a child?
answerDescription: In "Extreme Risk", B'Elanna Torres tells Neelix that her grandmother used to make her banana pancakes with maple syrup and it always put a smile on her face. Neelix responds by replicating a stack of banana pancakes. "Well then," he says, "one smile coming right up."

question: Which Star Trek captain poisons the atmosphere of a Maquis colony to catch a traitor?
answerDescription: In order to catch the traitorous Michael Eddington, Sisko launches a biogenic weapon composed of trilithium resin that poisons the atmosphere of a Maquis colony and forces Eddington to surrender. Needless to say, he doesn't clear this tactic with Starfleet.

question: Who is Wesley's mother?
answerDescription: Wesley Crusher arrives on the Enterprise-D with his mother, Beverly Crusher.

question: Who is the Chief Medical Officer of Deep Space Nine?
answerDescription: Dr. Julian Subatoi Bashir is the Chief Medical Officer of space station Deep Space Nine and the U.S.S. Defiant.

question: How many different TV series have William Shatner and Leonard Nimoy appeared in together?
answerDescription: Shatner and Nimoy have appeared together in episodes of six different series: The Man from U.N.C.L.E. (1964), Mission: Impossible (1966), Star Trek (1966), Star Trek: The Animated Series (1973), T.J. Hooker (1982) and Futurama (1999).

question: What elite group of cadets did Wesley Crusher join at the Academy?
answerDescription: While at the academy, Wesley joins an elite group of cadets known as Nova Squadron. His involvement with the group leads to his losing academic credits when a squadron-mate is killed attempting a dangerous and prohibited flight maneuver.

question: What Deep Space Nine character is a Trill symbiont?
answerDescription: Dax is a Trill symbiont--a life form that lives inside humanoid hosts.

question: Who puts Picard and the Enterprise crew on trial in "Encounter at Farpoint"?
answerDescription: In "Encounter at Farpoint", Q puts Picard and the Enterprise crew on trial, arguing that humanity is a dangerous race and should be destroyed. When they later save the life of a kidnapped alien, Q agrees to defer judgement, though he suggest this won't be his last word on the matter.

question: Who serves as ship's cook aboard Voyager?
answerDescription: When Neelix joins the Voyager crew, he appoints himself ship's cook.

question: Which former co-star had a long-standing feud with William Shatner?
answerDescription: William Shatner's well-documented feud with former co-star George Takei simmered for decades. Both actors took jabs at each other during major media interviews, including on Howard Stern, Real Time with Bill Maher, and even in their autobiographies.

question: What character owns a bar on Deep Space Nine?
answerDescription: Before opening a bar, known as Quark's, on the station, Quark served as a cook aboard a Ferengi freighter for eight years.

question: Who is Data's brother?
answerDescription: Lore is an android of the same model and appearance as Lt. Commander Data of the U.S.S. Enterprise-D. Both were created by Dr. Noonien Soong, but Lore was equipped with an emotion chip that made him unstable. He was responsible for the death of all colonists on Omicron Theta and proved exceptionally dangerous during several encounters with his "brother" Data and the crew of the Enterprise.

question: Whose cover version of "Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds" was voted "worst massacre of a The Beatles song ever" in May 2003?
answerDescription: According to Rolling Stone, Shatner claims he recorded "Lucy In The Sky With Diamonds" in the voice of somebody tripping on LSD. Nobody has ever tripped that bad.

question: What was the name of Spock's betrothed in the episode "Amok Time"?
answerDescription: Vulcans are bonded as children to fulfill the pon farr commitment, and T'Pring was chosen as Spock's mate. But when T'Pring arrives for the ceremony she brings Stonn, a pureblood Vulcan with whom she has fallen in love.

question: What is the name of Worf's son?
answerDescription: Alexander Rozhenko is the son of Worf and Federation Ambassador K'Ehleyr. He was born on the 43rd day of Maktag in 2366 and is a member of the House of Mogh and the House of Martok.

question: How did Captain Kirk's brother die?
answerDescription: Kirk's brother Sam was a research biologist on Deneva. When vessels from Ingraham B arrived carrying neural parasites, many of the colonists were infected, including Sam. Although his wife managed to send a distress call to the Enterprise, Sam died before help could arrive.

question: Which of the following is a Klingon insult?
answerDescription: "d'blok" is a Klingon insult, though the exact meaning is unclear.

question: In "Mudd's Women", what was the name of the pill the women took to stay beautiful?
answerDescription: In order to pawn the women off on unsuspecting husbands, Mudd gives them the "Venus Drug" which makes them appear more beautiful than they would otherwise seem.

question: What quadrant is home to the Founders?
answerDescription: The Gamma Quadrant is home to the Changelings, or Founders. The majority of it is ruled by the Dominion.

question: In "Mirror, Mirror", how do Kirk, McCoy, Scotty, and Uhura end up on an alternate universe Enterprise?
answerDescription: An ion storm causes a transporter malfunction, and the landing team instead materialize aboard an unfamiliar Enterprise. Their alternate universe counterparts simultaneously materialise on the Enterprise in the Federation universe, and are thrown in the brig by Mr Spock who immediately recognizes the changed personalities of the barbarian landing party.

question: Who was originally cast as Counselor Troi?
answerDescription: Denise Crosby was originally cast to play Counselor Troi, and Marina Sirtis was cast as security chief Lt. Macha Hernandez, but they switched roles during rehearsals and the security chief's name was changed to Lt. Natasha Yar.

question: In "The City on the Edge of Forever", who is Dr. McCoy treating when he accidentally injects himself with an overdose of cordrazine?
answerDescription: Dr. McCoy is treating an injured Lt. Hikaru Sulu when the Enterprise is rocked by a distortion and McCoy accidentally injects himself with an overdose of cordrazine which makes him temporarily insane.

question: Who replaced Dr. Crusher in the second season of Star Trek: The Next Generation?
answerDescription: Frustrated with the lack of character development for Dr. Crusher, Gates McFadden clashed with producers which led to her release after the first season. In Season 2, Dr. Crusher was replaced by Dr. Kate Pulaski, played by Diana Muldaur. However, producer Rick Berman personally phoned McFadden to convince her to return for Season 3.

question: What never appears on Enterprise schematics?
answerDescription: As a running gag, bathrooms never appear on Enterprise schematics. This joke is referenced in Star Trek: First Contact when Zefram Cochrane asks Geordi, "Don't you people from the 24th Century ever pee?"

question: Why did Worf's prosthetic forehead change in season 2 of Star Trek: The Next Generation
options: THE ORIGINAL TOOK TOO LONG TO APPLY
answerDescription: Worf's prosthetic forehead changed in season 2 because the original was stolen.

question: In "Mirror, Mirror", who tries to assassinate Captain Kirk?
answerDescription: Kirk is nearly assassinated by Chekov and his henchmen, one of whom betrays Chekov and saves Kirk's life. Later in the same episode, Sulu attempts to assassinate Kirk as well.

question: In "Mirror, Mirror", who does Captain Kirk find waiting in his bed?
answerDescription: After being transported to the alternate Enterprise, Kirk finds the beautiful Lieutenant Marlena Moreau, who refers to herself as the "Captain's Woman", stretched out on his bed.

question: In Klingon mythology, what monster guards the gates of Gre'thor?
answerDescription: Fek'lhr was a monstrous, feral Klingon who was believed to guard the gates of Gre'thor.

question: What unproduced Gene Roddenberry series eventually became Star Trek: The Motion Picture?
answerDescription: Star Trek: Phase II was an unproduced television series created by Gene Roddenberry as a sequel to Star Trek: The Original Series. It would have featured most of the original crew, minus Spock who would have been replaced with a full vulcan named Xon. However, Barry Diller, Chief Executive Officer of Paramount Pictures, decided the pilot, "In Thy Image", would work better as a feature film, and the series was eventually converted into Star Trek: The Motion Picture.

question: In "The City on the Edge of Forever", what organization does Edith Keeler run?
answerDescription: The 21st Street Mission was a homeless shelter organized and run by Edith Keeler around the time of the Great Depression. Kirk and Spock find jobs there while they search for Dr. McCoy.

question: What actor died a month before the release of Star Trek Beyond?
answerDescription: A month before the film's release, Anton Yelchin died in a freak car accident. During the ending credits, there is a dedication caption which reads: "For Anton".

question: Who complains of being "drafted" in Star Trek: The Motion Picture?
answerDescription: When Kirk orders Dr. McCoy's commission reactivated in Star Trek: The Motion Picture, a resentful McCoy complains of being "drafted".

question: What do the inhabitants of Gamma Trianguli VI worship?
answerDescription: In "The Apple", the crew of the Enterprise visits Gamma Trianguli VI, a tropical planet whose primitive inhabitants worship an ancient computer called Vaal.

question: What Algerian-born actress plays Jaylah in Star Trek Beyond?
answerDescription: Sofia Boutella plays Jaylah, a scavenger who teams up with the Enterprise crew to defeat Krall.

question: What Star Trek character answers to the nickname "Bones"?
answerDescription: Leonard McCoy served as chief medical officer of the U.S.S. Enterprise under Captain James T. Kirk who often called him "Bones".

question: What former transporter chief was later promoted to Chief of Operations on Deep Space Nine?
answerDescription: Miles O'Brien originally served as transporter chief of the U.S.S. Enterprise-D. He was later promoted to Chief of Operations of Deep Space Nine.

question: Which character was the Captain's yeoman aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise?
answerDescription: Janice Rand was the Captain's yeoman on board the U.S.S. Enterprise and first appeared in the episode "The Man Trap". She was originally intended to be Kirk's love interest, but was released midway through the first season.

question: What language do the angels in Supernatural speak?
answerDescription: The angels in Supernatural speak Enochian. But to (most) humans it just sounds like a very high-pitched shriek!

question: What is Crowley's nickname for Sam Winchester?
answerDescription: Crowley often calls Sam "Moose" and Dean "Squirrel."

question: What 80s rock star is possessed by Lucifer in season 12 of Supernatural?
answerDescription: In "Mamma Mia" (Season 12, episode 2), Lucifer takes over the body of washed-up rock star Vince Vincente (Rick Springfield).

question: Who are Sam and Dean's parents?
answerDescription: Sam and Dean's parents are John and Mary Winchester. After Mary was killed by the demon Azazel, John Winchester became a hunter and raised his two sons to fight the supernatural.

question: What was the title of the show originally going to be?
answerDescription: Originally, the show was going to be called Unnatural and it was about a reporter going around researching urban legends and writing about them in his column. It had absolutely nothing to do with the Winchester brothers.

question: What angel wrote the Word of God tablets?
answerDescription: Metatron wrote the Word of God tablets. According to the demon tablet, he is an Archangel, but Metatron himself claims to be an angel from the secretarial division.

question: What hunter married a werewolf named Bess?
answerDescription: After being turned into a werewolf, Garth Fitzgerald IV joins a pack of werewolves that peacefully coexist with humans (mostly) and married one named Bess.

question: In "Scoobynatural" (season 13, episode 16
answerDescription: Dean spends the whole episode chasing after Daphne, but it is Sam who finally locks lips with Velma.

question: What does Dean call his 1967 Chevy Impala?
options: HE DOESN'T HAVE A NICKNAME FOR HIS CAR
answerDescription: Dean often calls his car, Baby!

question: What Prophet of the Lord is chosen to interpret the Word of God after Sam and Dean break it out of the slab of stone it is trapped in?
answerDescription: Kevin Tran was an advanced placement high school student whose life was turned upside down when he became a Prophet. Kevin translated the Leviathan tablet which led to the downfall of the leviathans, and then uncovered the secrets of closing Hell.

question: Who is Dean named after?
answerDescription: Dean Winchester is named after his grandmother, Deanna Campbell.

question: What is God's name?
answerDescription: God, initially known to Sam and Dean as Chuck Shurley, is a powerful primordial being who created the universe and nearly everything it contains, including the low-selling Supernatural book series, which he writes under the pen name Carver Edlund.

question: In "Advanced Thanatology" (Season 13, episode 5
answerDescription: Dean has fought his way out of dark places before, and he'll do it again, the same way he always does: with bullets, bacon, and booze.

question: Who kills Hitler in Season 12?
answerDescription: In "The One You've Been Waiting For" (Season 12, Episode 5), Dean kills Hitler who's soul has been trapped in a gold pocket watch for 70 years.

question: What book does Charlie read to her comatose mother?
options: HARRY POTTER AND THE SORCERER'S STONE
answerDescription: In "Pac-Man Fever" (Season 8, episode 20), Charlie signs forms to have her mother taken off of life-support, but before she lets her mother die, she reads The Hobbit to her one last time.

question: What is the only episode between season 1 and season 10 that had NO onscreen death?
options: CHILDREN SHOULDN'T PLAY WITH DEAD THINGS
answerDescription: Season 10 episode 17, "Inside Man", is the ONLY episode in seasons 1-10 that doesn't have an onscreen death.

question: Which of the following is NOT the name of a supporting character from Supernatural?
answerDescription: Rick Grimes is a survivor of the zombie apocalypse in AMC's The Walking Dead.

question: What was Misha Collins' job before he was an actor?
answerDescription: That's right! Before Misha Collins became an actor, he had his very own software company!

question: Which Supernatural actor accidentally hurt himself while trying to do his own stunts?
answerDescription: Jared Padalecki broke his hand trying to do his own stunt-work while filming season 2 of Supernatural.

question: Which of the following characters did the Pagan God Leshii NOT fight the Winchesters as?
answerDescription: In "Fallen Idols" (Season 5, Episode 5), the Pagan God Leshii fights the Winchesters as Paris Hilton, Abraham Lincoln, and Gandhi -- but NOT Beyoncé.

question: What has Sam been scared of since childhood?
answerDescription: In "Everybody Loves a Clown" (Season 2, Episode 2), Sam and Dean investigate a series of murders that occur while a circus is in town. Dean teases Sam about his fear of clowns: "You still bust out crying whenever you see Ronald McDonald on the television."

question: What name do Sam and Dean use to find each other when they are separated?
answerDescription: In "The Usual Suspects" (Season 2, Episode 7), Sam and Dean's practice of picking the first motel in the yellow pages and signing in as "Jim Rockford" is revealed to be the method they use to find each other when they get separated. Jim Rockford is a fictional private investigator from the 1970s TV series, The Rockford Files.

question: Who was single-handedly responsible for the extinction of the original Men of Letters?
answerDescription: Abaddon was one of only two remaining Knights of Hell, the other being her retired master, Cain. Abaddon was single-handedly responsible for the extinction of the original Men of Letters.

question: What hunter first crossed paths with Sam and Dean while working as an I.T. expert at Richard Roman Enterprises?
answerDescription: Charlie Bradbury (played by Felicia Day) first crosses paths with Sam and Dean while working as an I.T. expert at Richard Roman Enterprises. She is initially reluctant to get involved in the supernatural world by helping the Winchesters, but decides to become a hunter herself by her fourth episode.

question: Which character was first introduced to the supernatural world when his wife Karen was possessed by a demon?
answerDescription: Bobby Singer was first introduced to the supernatural world when his wife Karen was possessed by a demon. He was forced to kill her and afterwards dedicated his life to hunting supernatural creatures.

question: What is the license plate # of Dean's Chevy Impala during all of season 1 and most of season 2?
answerDescription: The license plate # on Dean's Chevy Impala is "KAZ 2Y5" (Kansas plates) for all of season one and most of season two, until they switch to "CNK 80Q3" Ohio plates in order to avoid detection.

question: What billionaire businessman is secretly the leader of the leviathans?
answerDescription: Shortly after they were unknowingly released by Castiel, the leviathans infiltrated human society, with their leader murdering and impersonating the real Dick Roman.

question: What angel used a human vessel named "Alfie" who worked at Weiner Hut?
answerDescription: In "What's Up, Tiger Mommy?", an angel named Samandriel takes the vessel of a young man named Alfie who works at Weiner Hut. He bids for the Word of God tablet, but loses.

question: What hunter died while saving Sam and Dean from a hellhound?
answerDescription: Jo Harvelle died while saving Sam and Dean from a hellhound sent to kill them by the demon Meg Masters.

question: In which season of Supernatural is the angel Castiel first introduced?
answerDescription: In the season four premiere "Lazarus Rising", Castiel is introduced as the angel who brought Dean back from Hell and resurrected him.

question: Why are Sam and Dean transported back in time by Castiel to March 5, 1861?
answerDescription: In "Frontierland", Sam and Dean are transported back in time by Castiel to Sunrise, Wyoming to kill a phoenix and get its ashes to use against Eve, "the Mother of All."

question: Which character said: "You're never too young to kill monsters, especially the ones that kill your family."?
answerDescription: Krissy Chambers is the teenage daughter of hunter Lee Chambers. In "Freaks and Geeks" (Season 8, Episode 18), she says: "You're never too young to kill monsters, especially the ones that kill your family."

question: What was Bobby Singer's Rottweiler named?
answerDescription: Rumsfeld was Bobby Singer's Rottweiler, named after Donald Rumsfeld, who was the U.S. Secretary of Defense from 2001-2006.

question: Who  designed most of the warding for the Men of Letters bunker?
answerDescription: Magnus was so good at spells, he was made the Men of Letters Master of Spells right after he was initiated into the order. He acted as Henry Winchester, Sam and Dean's grandfather's mentor and designed most of the warding for the Men of Letters bunker.

question: What FBI agent pursues the Winchesters, believing them to be serial killers?
answerDescription: Victor Henriksen is an FBI agent who pursues the Winchesters, believing them to be serial killers. When he finally captures them and holds them in a small town jail, demons attack the station. Forced to accept the existence of the supernatural, Henriksen agrees to help Sam and Dean fight off the demon horde.

question: What famous writer released Eleanor Visyak from Purgatory?
answerDescription: Eleanor Visyak is a 900-year-old creature who possessed the body of H. P. Lovecraft's maid, Eleanor, after he cast a spell that released her from Purgatory.

question: What vampire helped Dean escape Purgatory?
answerDescription: Benny Lafitte helps Dean escape from Purgatory in exchange for being brought back to life.

question: How many times does Dean die in the series?
answerDescription: Dean dies over 100 times in one episode alone ("Mystery Spot") when he is trapped in Gabriel's time loop. Known causes of death include getting shot in the chest, being hit by a car, being crushed by a dresser, choking on a sausage, eating a bad taco, being electrocuted plugging in an electric razor, and accidentally being bludgeoned by an axe.

question: What actress played the demon Ruby in season four of Supernatural?
answerDescription: Genevieve Padalecki (nee Cortese) played Ruby in season four of Supernatural. She is also known for her role on the television series Wildfire as Kris Furillo. She and Jared started dating during the filming of season four and were married on February 27, 2010 in Sun Valley, Idaho.

question: What is Sam's dog named?
answerDescription: Riot is an Australian Shepherd who was hit by the Impala. Sam rushes the dog to a veterinary hospital and later agrees to take care of it. In another episode, Sam has memories of a Golden Retriever named Bones.

question: What is the name of Castiel's human host?
answerDescription: Because perceiving his actual form typically results in blindness, the angel Castiel takes a human host -- James "Jimmy" Novak, a "devout man" who agrees to become a vessel for Castiel and remains so until Heaven takes Castiel back to Heaven for "re-indoctrination" after his superiors become concerned that he is becoming too close to humans -- Dean in particular.

question: Which cast member owns dogs named Harley and Sadie?
answerDescription: Harley and Sadie (aka Harley Brown and Sadie Lane) are Jared Padalecki's dogs. Rescued from the same shelter, Harley (Mastiff cross) and Sadie (German Shepherd mix) starred with Jared as part of an anti-fur campaign run by People for the Ethical treatment of Animals (PETA).

question: Which character is a member of the London chapter of the Men of Letters?
answerDescription: Lady Antonia Bevell is a member of the London chapter of the Men of Letters.

question: Which character said, "What I loved, it ain't here anymore. It was snuffed out long ago by monsters like me."?
answerDescription: In "Blood Brother," the vampire Benny Lafitte says: "What I loved, it ain't here anymore. It was snuffed out long ago by monsters like me."

question: Who is the King of Hell?
answerDescription: Crowley is a demon and the King of Hell. He was formerly the King of the Crossroads and right-hand man of the first demon and then-de facto ruler of Hell, Lilith.

question: Who does Dean kill with the First Blade?
answerDescription: After trying to lure him into a trap, Abaddon is killed by Dean with the First Blade when the Mark of Cain grants him immunity to her powers.

question: What is Cain doing when Dean and Crowley track him down, looking for the First Blade?
answerDescription: While tracking the First Blade, Dean and Crowley are sent to Missouri, where they find Cain tending bees on a farm.

question: Who does Sam first meet while hitchhiking?
answerDescription: Sam first meets Meg Masters while hitchhiking. Their first encounter is brief, as she soon gets a lift from "shady van guy."

question: Who did Cain marry?
answerDescription: Eventually, Cain fell in love with and married a woman named Colette. She forgave him for his past atrocities, only asking that he never kill again.

question: Who kills the hunter Gwen Campbell?
answerDescription: While investigating a series of murders, Dean is infected by the creature dubbed the "Khan Worm" which forces him to kill Gwen.

question: Which character said: "Listen to me, you've got this dark pit inside you. I know. Believe me, I know. But that doesn't mean you have to fall into it."?
answerDescription: In "Metamorphosis", Sam says: "Listen to me, you've got this dark pit inside you. I know. Believe me, I know. But that doesn't mean you have to fall into it."

question: Which of the following characters is NOT one of the Special Children, chosen by the Yellow-Eyed Demon to take part in the Apocalypse?
answerDescription: Dean Winchester is NOT one of the "Special Children," chosen by the Yellow-Eyed Demon to take part in the Apocalypse.

question: Whose private jet did Dick Roman use to deliver a package?
answerDescription: Dick's package arrived from in America via New York where the Leviathan Agent Valente expedited it through customs. It then flew to Downey airport Chicago on one of Donald trump's private jets. This information is obtained when Charlie Bradbury hacks Dick's e-mails.

question: Who is Crowley's mother?
answerDescription: Rowena, portrayed by Ruth Connell, is a powerful witch introduced in the tenth season. She is eventually revealed to be Crowley's mother.

question: What is Dean's favorite dessert?
answerDescription: The biggest Supernatural romance may be Dean Winchester and his love of pie! Unfortunately for Dean, it has become a running gag on the show that he rarely gets to eat his favorite dessert.

question: Who broke the final seal that allowed Lucifer to escape Hell?
answerDescription: Lucifer was finally freed and allowed to roam the Earth when the final seal (the death of Lilith) was broken by Sam. Freed from his cage, he set out to bring about the Apocalypse and cleanse the Earth of human beings.

question: What friend of Bobby Singer is a skilled psychic?
answerDescription: Pamela Barnes is a skilled psychic who helps Bobby discover who or what pulled Dean out of Hell. She holds a seance and learns it was a being named Castiel, but when she gets a glimpse of the angel, her eyes are burnt out and she becomes permanently blind.

question: Who was the first demon Lucifer created?
answerDescription: Lilith was the first demon Lucifer created, as well as being the final seal of the 66 Seals that had to be broken for him to be freed from his cage.

question: What reaper comes to collect Dean's soul after he goes into a coma?
answerDescription: Tessa is a reaper who guides the deceased to the afterlife. When Dean goes into a coma following a car accident in which he is critically wounded, she poses as another coma patient and tries to convince him to "move on", but Azazel intervenes and restores Dean to life.

question: What is the demon Crowley's real name?
answerDescription: Crowley's real name is Fergus Rodrick MacLeod.

question: Which of the following characters has NOT been used by Lucifer as a vessel?
answerDescription: Lucifer has used Nick, Castiel, and Sam as vessels -- but never Dean.

question: Which character is God?
answerDescription: God, initially known to Sam and Dean as Chuck Shurley, is a powerful primordial being who created the universe and nearly everything it contains.

question: In which episode does Sam lose his shoe?
answerDescription: In "Bad Day at Black Rock", after losing an unlucky rabbit's foot, Sam steps in gum -- then loses his shoe down a drain.

question: Who is the sheriff of Stillwater, Minnesota?
answerDescription: Donna Hanscum is the sheriff of Stillwater, Minnesota. She was married to another sheriff named Doug who left her because of her weight.

question: Which character had a son that came back as a zombie during the Apocalypse?
answerDescription: Jody Mills was the sheriff of Bobby's hometown of Sioux Falls, South Dakota. She had a son, Owen, who died and came back as a zombie during the Apocalypse. At first, she tried to prevent Sam and Dean from investigating, but when her son killed her husband, she worked with the Winchesters to kill the remaining zombies.

question: What sort of supernatural creature is Amy Pond?
answerDescription: Amy pond is a kitsune, a werewolf-like monster that feeds on the pituitary gland, a part of the brain, without which they will die. When Sam discovers her secret, he lets her go because she saved his life. Years later, Sam notices similar killing happening again, and tracks Amy down.

question: Who was Sam's girlfriend at the beginning of the series?
answerDescription: Jessica Lee Moore was Sam's girlfriend at the start of the series. He planned to ask her to marry him, but she was killed by a demon.

question: Which of the following is an invisible demonic creature of shadow?
answerDescription: A daeva is an ancient demonic creature of shadow that can be summoned by other demons. Like hellhounds, daevas are used as invisible killers. While they are invisible, daevas appear as humanoid shadows.

question: Which of the following characters has a second heart?
answerDescription: Eldon Styne is the heir to the powerful Styne Family, a dynasty that causes and takes advantage of disasters such as the Nazi rise to power and the September 11th attacks to make a profit. Like all other members of his family, Eldon has received surgical enhancements including a second heart.

question: Whose sister was abducted by a vampire?
answerDescription: When Gordon Walker was 18 years old, a vampire broke into his house and abducted his sister. Gordon ran away from home, learned how to fight, hunt, and kill vampires, and tracked down the vampire who had taken his sister. He killed the vampire, as well as his sister, who had been turned, marking the beginning of his hatred for the undead.

question: Whose memories did Castiel erase at Dean's request?
answerDescription: Dean lived with Lisa Braeden and her son for a full year, but their relationship came to a tragic end when Dean asked Castiel to erase her memories of him.

question: How much older is Dean than Sam?
answerDescription: Dean was four when his mother died and Sam was six months old.

question: What alcoholic beverage does Dean enjoy in the episode "Tall Tales"?
answerDescription: In "Tall Tales" (Season 2, Episode 15), Dean enjoys a purple nurple.

question: In the episode "The Benders", what was killing people?
answerDescription: In "The Benders", a backwoods family of hunters likes to stuff and mount their kill as trophies. Only they hunt other people.

question: What is the name of the boy that Dean suspects may be his son?
answerDescription: When Dean learns that Lisa Braeden has a son who bears a striking resemblance to him, he suspects that he may be a father. But she insists that Ben is not his son.

question: What did Dean name the monster hybrids created by Eve in her quest for the ultimate supernatural predator?
answerDescription: Since Dean discovered these creatures, Bobby told him he should get to name them. He named them Jefferson Starships after the 1970s band "because they're horrible and hard to kill."

question: Which of the following is not a term for Leviathans?
answerDescription: The Leviathans are ancient, primordial monsters, predating angels, humans, and even the soul itself. They are also known as The Old Ones, Chompers, or Levis -- but NOT as tar babies.

question: Who designed the locked door that keeps the Devil's Gate from opening?
answerDescription: Samuel Colt is a hunter who lived in the 19th century and the creator of the Colt--a gun that can kill almost any supernatural being. Colt also designed the locked door that keeps the portal to Hell known as the Devil's Gate from opening. The Devil's Gate and the Colt gun are linked together--the gun serves as the key to the gate, allowing it to be opened by inserting the Colt's muzzle into the key hole.

question: What is Jensen Ackles favorite NFL team?
answerDescription: Jensen Ackles is a fan of the Dallas Cowboys

question: Which Winchester was the first to die?
answerDescription: Mary Winchester dies in the pilot episode of Supernatural when she interrupts the Yellow-Eyed Demon lurking beside Sam's crib. The demon kills her and pins her to the ceiling, then sets the nursery on fire.

question: What is Jared Padalecki's favorite ice cream flavor?
answerDescription: Jared's favorite ice cream is chocolate chip cookie dough.

question: What was the yellow eyed demon's real name?
answerDescription: Azazel is the yellow-eyed demon, one of the Generals of Hell who planned to bring his army of black-eyed demons forth from Hell to unleash upon the world in preparation for the Apocalypse.

question: Which cast member founded the non-profit organization Random Acts?
answerDescription: Misha Collins (Castiel) founded Random Acts, a non-profit organization aiming to conquer the world one random act of kindness at a time.

question: What did Jensen Ackles plan to study before he became an actor?
answerDescription: Before he moved to LA and became an actor, Jensen planned to study sports medicine at Texas Tech University and become a physical therapist.

question: What is the name of Sam and Dean's half brother?
answerDescription: Adam Milligan was the son of John Winchester and Kate Milligan, and half-brother to Sam and Dean.

question: What is Jared Padalecki's middle name?
answerDescription: Jared's middle name is Tristan

question: What makes Dr. Sexy sexy?
answerDescription: In "Changing Channels", Gabriel traps Sam and Dean in the TV show Dr. Sexy, M.D., and Dean guesses that Gabriel is disguised as Dr. Sexy because he's wearing the wrong shoes: "The thing that makes Dr. Sexy sexy is the fact that he wears cowboy boots. Not tennis shoes."

question: Which Supernatural cast member organized the world's largest international photo scavenger hunt?
answerDescription: In November 2001, Misha Collins became the Guinness World Record Holder for organizing the world's largest international photo scavenger hunt: The Greatest International Scavenger Hunt the World Has Ever Seen.

question: What is the name adopted by Harry Spengler and Ed Zeddmore for their reality TV series about a group of paranormal investigators?
answerDescription: The Ghostfacers was the name adopted by Harry Spengler and Ed Zeddmore for their reality TV series pilot about a group of paranormal investigators who cross paths with the Winchesters in several episodes. The Ghostfacers is run out of Ed's parents' garage.

question: In the pilot episode of Supernatural, what is on Jessica's t-shirt?
answerDescription: In the pilot episode, Jessica wears a Smurfs t-shirt.

question: Which of the following actors has NOT played Dean Winchester?
answerDescription: Ridge Canipe, Dylan Everett, and Nicolai Guistra have all played Young Dean Winchester in various episodes. Colin Ford played Young Sam.

question: Who tortures Dean when he is sent to Hell at the end of the third season?
answerDescription: When Dean is sent to Hell at the end of the third season, it is the demon Alastair who tortures him, stopping only when he finally convinces Dean to torture other souls himself.

question: Which character was turned into a toy in "I Believe the Children Are Our Future"?
answerDescription: In "I Believe the Children Are Our Future", a young boy with strange demonic powers turns Castiel into an action figure.

question: What symbol is identified with the Men of Letters?
answerDescription: The men of letters are identified with the crest of the Aquarian Star, a six-pointed sign (or unicursal hexagram) that represents great magic and power and was linked to the gates of Atlantis.

question: What is the name of Crowley's son?
answerDescription: Gavin MacLeod was the Scottish son of Crowley, when he was a human named Fergus Roderick McLeod.

question: What alias does Dean use in the pilot episode?
answerDescription: In the pilot episode, Dean gives his name as "Ted Nugent" when he is being interrogated by the police.

question: What does Dean call the Men of Letters Bunker?
answerDescription: The Men of Letters Bunker, or "the Batcave" as Dean calls it, was the secret base of operations for the Men of Letters.

question: Which Supernatural character joined Dorothy in her quest to rid Oz of the Wicked Witch's forces and find her lost dog, Toto?
answerDescription: After killing the Wicked Witch with the Ruby slippers and closing to door to Oz just in time to stop the Flying Monkeys from reaching earth, Charlie Bradbury joined Dorothy in her quest to rid Oz of the witch's evil forces for good.

question: How did Dean get his first Breaking & Entering charge?
answerDescription: In "Beyond the Mat" (Season 11, episode 15), Dean meets one of his childhood heroes, the wrestler Gunner Lawless, and informs him that he got his first "B&E" for breaking into a house to watch Lawless' cage match on the homeowners' pay-per-view.

question: "D'oh!"
answerDescription: Homer embodies many American working class stereotypes: he is crude, obese, incompetent, lazy, clumsy, dim-witted, hot-tempered, childish and addicted to alcohol, junk food and watching television.

question: "You rang?"
answerDescription: Lurch, the Addams Family's 6 ft. 9 in. manservant, is sometimes seen carrying a feather duster. He is close friends with the disembodied hand Thing.

question: "That's what she said."
answerDescription: Regional Manager of the Scranton branch of paper distribution company Dunder Mifflin, Michael Scott might possibly be the world's worst boss due to his insensitivity and inappropriate workplace behavior.

question: "Up your nose with a rubber hose."
answerDescription: The "unofficial official" leader and resident heartthrob of the Sweathogs, Vinnie is famous for singing his own name to the tune of "Barbara Ann" and dancing around in celebration of the coolest, greatest guy he knows: himself.

question: "I know nothing!"
answerDescription: Instead of reporting any suspicious activity to Kommandant Wilhelm Klink. Sgt. Schultz would often announce either "I know nothing!", "I see nothing!" or "I hear nothing!" At other times, he would allow himself to be bribed with Corporal LeBeau's excellent cuisine or items from the prisoners' Red Cross packages.

question: "Missed it by that much."
answerDescription: Although he wasn't a big success at spy school, failing Torture three straight years, Maxwell Smart (also known as agent 86) eventually became CONTROL's top spy. He joined the agency to "fight the forces of evil and serve on the side of niceness." Besides, he needed the money.

question: "Well, isn't that special?"
answerDescription: Enid Strict, better known as The Church Lady, was a recurring character from a series of sketches on Saturday Night Live. a spoof of "holier-than-thou" Christian churchgoers, she was known for the catchphrases, "Well, isn't that SPECIAL?!" and "Could it be ... SATAN?"

question: "Here's ... Johnny!"
answerDescription: McMahon and Johnny Carson began their association on the ABC game show Who Do You Trust?, but McMahon made himself a household name as Carson's sidekick, announcer and second banana on NBC's The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson.

question: "Nanu-nanu."
answerDescription: Mork, an extraterrestrial from the planet Ork, was known for the Orkan greeting "Na-Nu Na-Nu." Also for "Shazbot", Mork's Orkan profanity of choice.

question: "Wocka, wocka."
answerDescription: Fozzy Bear debuted on The Muppet Show as the show's stand-up comic who constantly employs the catchphrase, "Wocka Wocka Wocka!" Shortly after telling a joke, he is usually ridiculed from balcony by hecklers Statler and Waldorf.

question: "Ahhh, what's up doc?"
answerDescription: Bugs is characterized by a Brooklyn accent, his portrayal as a trickster, and his catch phrase "Eh... What's up, doc?"

question: "Dyn-o-mite!"
answerDescription: The oldest son of James and Florida Evans, J.J. dreams of becoming famous. Until that day, his responsibilities include doing well in school and looking out for his younger siblings. Unfortunately, he isn't very good at either of these tasks.

question: "Nyuk, nyuk, nyuk."
answerDescription: A member of the Three Stooges, Curly was well known for his high-pitched voice and vocal expressions ("nyuk-nyuk-nyuk!", "woob-woob-woob!", "soitenly!" Also for barking like a dog.

question: "Ay, caramba!"
answerDescription: The mischievous, rebellious, misunderstood and "potentially dangerous" eldest child of Homer and Marge Simpson, Bart is known for a number of catchphrases, including "Eat my shorts!", "Ay, caramba!", and "Don't have a cow, man."

question: "Bang, zoom, to the moon, Alice!"
answerDescription: A bus driver from Bensonhurst, Brooklyn, Kramden lectured, shouted and ranted his way right into the hearts of America.

question: "Hello, Newman."
answerDescription: Jerry's trademark greeting for Newman is to say "Hello, Newman" in a snide and condescending tone, while Newman responds "Hello, Jerry" more joyfully.

question: What is Walter White's alias in Breaking Bad?
answerDescription: As Walt is pulled deeper into the illicit drug trade, becoming more and more ruthless as the series progresses, he eventually transforms fully into his "Heisenberg" drug kingpin persona.

question: What is the phrase on the UFO poster in Fox Mulder's office in X-Files?
answerDescription: The famous "I Want to Believe" UFO poster from Fox Mulder's office in the "X-Files" continually had to be replaced as copies kept disappearing from the set. The poster on display at the Hollywood Entertainment Museum in Los Angeles is reportedly one of the last available copies of the original set-used posters.

question: What does New Jersey-based mobster Tony Soprano suffer from in The Sopranos?
answerDescription: Tony suffers from panic attacks, brought on primarily by the difficulties that he faces as he tries to balance his family life with his role as the leader of a criminal organization. Throughout the series, he engages in therapy sessions with psychiatrist Jennifer Melfi in an effort to control these attacks.

question: In Game of Thrones, What does Daenerys recieve as a wedding gift from Illyrio Mopatis?
answerDescription: Daenerys is given three apparently fossilized dragons eggs on the occasion of her wedding to Khal Drogo. After his death, she places the eggs next to Drogo and lights his funeral pyre, then steps into the flames herself. The next morning, she is found in the ashes, unharmed, flanked by three newly hatched dragons.

question: What is Sterling Cooper's largest client in season one of Mad Men?
answerDescription: As the series opens, the agency is working to reassure Lucky Strike, whose account is the firm's bread and butter, in the face of resurgent medical research demonstrating smoking is harmful and related lawsuits and impending legislation harmful to the tobacco industry.

question: In Stranger Things, what game does Will Byers play just before his abduction?
answerDescription: Will encounters the creature from the Upside Down and mysteriously vanishes while cycling home from a Dungeons & Dragons session with his friends Mike Wheeler, Dustin Henderson and Lucas Sinclair.

question: Which TV drama showed the first interracial kiss on American network television?
answerDescription: In the Star Trek episode entitled "Plato's Stepchildren," which aired on November 22, 1968, Captain Kirk (William Shatner) kissed Lieutenant Uhura (Nichelle Nichols). Some stations in the South (U.S.) originally refused to air the episode.

question: How does Rick get to Atlanta in the pilot episode of The Walking Dead?
answerDescription: When he sets out for Atlanta where a refugee camp is rumored to exist, Rick runs out of gas and is forced to abandon his car. He continues the rest of the way on horseback.

question: What is the name of Michael Knight's car on Knight Rider?
answerDescription: The character of KITT (Knight Industries Two Thousand) in the original Knight Rider series was physically embodied as a modified 1982 Pontiac Trans Am with numerous special features such as Turbo Boost, the ability to drive 'himself', a front mounted scanner bar that allowed KITT to 'see', and 'molecular bonded shell' body armor that was invulnerable to small arms fire, the impact of thrown objects, and even high speed impact with a cinder block wall.

question: Which Breaking Bad character wasn't supposed to live past the first season?
answerDescription: Producer Vince Gilligan had originally planned to kill Jesse off during the original nine-episode arc, but he realized early on that it would be a huge mistake, and the show ultimately ended up being largely about the tumultuous partnership between Walter White and his former student.

question: What brand of cigarettes does the Cigarette Smoking Man in The X-Files prefer?
answerDescription: The Cigarette Smoking Man (played by William B. Davis) only smokes Morley cigarettes. Rarely seen without a cigarette in his hand, the CSM was originally intended to be a non-speaking character always lurking in the shadows, but he was eventually given dialogue and became the show's primary antagonist.

question: In MacGyver what foundation does the title character work for?
answerDescription: MacGyver works as a "troubleshooter" for the Phoenix Foundation in Los Angeles, a non-profit think tank that often cooperates with government agencies, particularly the police or intelligence community.

question: Which Buffy the Vampire Slayer character is known as "Ripper"?
answerDescription: As an adult, Rupert Giles is a stuffy librarian and general authority figure, but as a young man he was rebellious and began to explore dark magic, earning him the name of "Ripper" from his friends.

question: Who kills Wild Bill Hickok in Deadwood?
answerDescription: McCall strides up to the poker table and shoots the famous gunfighter in the back of the head.

question: Who is "the Key" on Buffy the Vampire Slayer?
answerDescription: During season five, Buffy's younger sister Dawn suddenly appears out of nowhere. Although she is new to the series, to the characters it's as if she has always been there. It is later discovered that Dawn was created as a "Key" in human form that has the potential to unlock a Hell dimension.

question: How does Will communicate with his mother in Stranger Things?
answerDescription: Joyce believes Will is communicating through pulses in light bulbs. She builds an alphabetic board on her wall with Christmas lights, allowing Will to sign to her that he is "RIGHT HERE" and that she needs to "RUN".

question: What military order defends the realm against threats from the North in Game of Thrones?
answerDescription: The Night's Watch guards the Wall to keep the wildlings and White Walkers from crossing into the Seven Kingdoms.

question: What TV show is credited for a massive surge of applications for courses in forensic science?
answerDescription: The extreme popularity of CSI: Crime Scene Investigation not only spanned 15 seasons and spawned multiple spinoffs, it also encouraged many young fans to pursue a career in forensic science.

question: What was the first R-rated TV show?
answerDescription: In 1993, NYPD Blue became the first R-rated show in television history. Twenty-five percent of ABC's 225 affiliates chose to pre-empt the first episode.

question: On the television series Bones, Seeley Booth is descended from an assassin who killed which political figure?
answerDescription: Seeley Booth, played by David Boreanaz, is purportedly a member of the well-known Booth Family and, as such, is related to John Wilkes Booth, the American stage actor who assassinated President Abraham Lincoln.

question: What pets do the Stark children adopt in Game of Thrones?
answerDescription: After discovering six orphaned direwolf pups, Eddard Stark advocates killing the pups out of mercy, but when his son Jon suggests that it may be an omen (the direwolf is the symbol of House Stark), he agrees to let each of his children raise one of the pups.

question: What house at Hogwarts does Harry belong to?
answerDescription: Harry Potter belongs to the house of Gryffindor--the same house Harry's father belonged to when he went to the Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

question: What position does Harry play on his Quidditch team?
answerDescription: Harry Potter plays Seeker on the Gryffindor Quidditch team--his job is to catch the Golden Snitch to win his team 150 points.

question: How did Harry get the scar on his forehead?
options: HE CRASHED THE WEASLEY'S CAR INTO THE WHOMPING TREE
HE WAS ATTACKED BY A BASILISK
VOLDEMORT TRIED TO KILL HIM WHEN HE WAS A BABY
answerDescription: Lord Voldemort killed Harry's parents when he was a baby and tried to kill Harry. His spell did not work, but left Harry with a lightning shaped scar on his forehead.

question: What does the Sorcerer's Stone do?
options: TRANSFORMS THE ONE WHO HOLDS IT INTO AN ANIMAL
MAKES THE ONE THAT HOLDS IT INVISIBLE
TRANSFORMS ANY METAL INTO GOLD & PRODUCES THE ELIXER OF LIFE
TELLS THE ONE THAT HOLDS IT THEIR FUTURE
